author: UOL
title: São Paulo renova contrato com atacante Luciano até a temporada de 2026
text: Na noite desta quinta-feira, os torcedores são-paulinos ganharam um presente de fim de ano. O São Paulo anunciou a renovação do contrato do atacante Luciano até o fim da temporada de 2026. O antigo vínculo do jogador com o Tricolor era válido até 2024. Conforme apurado pela Gazeta Esportiva, o São Paulo havia proposto uma renovação até o fim de 2025. No entanto, Luciano desejava que seu novo vínculo fosse até 2026. Apesar do impasse, as negociações avançaram e a vontade do atacante prevaleceu. "A minha identificação com o clube é enorme desde o meu primeiro dia aqui. Estou muito feliz com a oportunidade de renovar o meu contrato e, assim, ficar mais tempo no São Paulo. Aprendi a gostar e amar este clube. Seguirei com a mesma vontade de ganhar e conquistar títulos. Agradeço pela confiança da torcida, da diretoria, da comissão técnica e dos meus companheiros. De coração, eu e a minha família agradecemos o carinho de cada um", apontou o atleta. Ele é dos nossos. ?? Luciano até 2026! [#VamosSãoPaulo]?? [pic.twitter.com/rZwolgNFGL] ? São Paulo FC (@SaoPauloFC) [December 28, 2023] O camisa 10 são-paulino também recebeu propostas de clubes da Árabia Saudita, mas tinha o desejo de permanecer do clube por mais temporadas. O atacante havia sido procurado pelo Al-Nassr, time saudita do astro Cristiano Ronaldo, e também pelo Cruz Azul, do México. Luciano chegou ao Tricolor paulista em agosto de 2020. Desde então, o atleta esteve em campo em 201 oportunidades com a camisa do São Paulo, marcou 67 gols e distribuiu 21 assistências, se convertendo no maior goleador do atual elenco. Em 2023, o atacante foi o jogador de linha do São Paulo com mais partidas disputadas. O atleta entrou em campo 65 vezes e foi o artilheiro da equipe no ano ao marcar 15 gols. Luciano foi, ainda, o segundo maior garçom do time, com oito assistências. "É motivo de comemoração poder renovar o contrato com o Luciano. Além de talentoso, é um jogador que sempre demonstrou empenho e criou uma identificação com a torcida", destacou Julio Casares, presidente do São Paulo. O dirigente, inclusive, comemorou a renovação em suas redes sociais.

author: El Dia
title: Lionel Messi presentó su productora “525 Rosario” junto a su familia
text:
Se anunció el lanzamiento de "525 Rosario", una nueva productora global que tiene a Lionel Messi y su familia como supervisores directos, con el objetivo de convertirse en un referente en la industria del entretenimiento.
Este ambicioso proyecto, que toma su nombre en honor a la ciudad natal de Messi en Rosario, trabajará en asociación con Smuggler Entertainment, responsable de importantes producciones sobre la carrera del astro argentino, como "Messi´s World Cup: The rise of a legend" y "Messi meets America".
"525 Rosario" se dedicará al desarrollo y producción de contenido premium para televisión, cine y deportes en vivo, además de eventos comunitarios. También se encargará de la producción de comerciales y contenido relacionado con deportistas de todo el mundo, incluido Messi, según informó la compañía en un comunicado.
El proyecto será supervisado tanto por la familia Messi como por Tim Pastore, director ejecutivo de Smuggler Entertainment, asegurando así la calidad y coherencia del contenido que se genere.
El propio Messi expresó su entusiasmo por el nuevo emprendimiento, asegurando que siempre ha tenido una fuerte conexión con el entretenimiento, tanto dentro como fuera de la cancha: "Tener la oportunidad de expandir el proyecto que creamos con Smuggler Entertainment para crear contenido y experiencias a escala global es algo que realmente me motiva", afirmó el delantero del Inter Miami.
Con oficinas en Miami y Los Ángeles, "525 Rosario" se posiciona como un jugador clave en la industria del entretenimiento global. El objetivo, según comunicaron desde la familia Messi, es "inspirar y conectar con personas de todo el mundo de una manera completamente nueva", aportando innovadoras narrativas y producciones con un enfoque global.
LE PUEDE INTERESAR
Estudiantes y la preocupación de Eduardo Domínguez por una baja importante antes de enfrentar a Vélez
LE PUEDE INTERESAR
Argentina, sigue en lo más alto del Ranking FIFA: ¿Cuáles son las primeras 10 mejores selecciones del mundo?
Con esta nueva productora, Messi no solo busca consolidar su legado en el deporte, sino también expandir su influencia hacía otros ámbitos, como el cine y la televisión. La participación activa de su familia en este proyecto refuerza la idea de que "525 Rosario" será un emprendimiento íntimamente ligado a los valores y visión del futbolista argentino.
 Ver esta publicación en Instagram Una publicación compartida de Leo Messi (@leomessi)
Las noticias locales nunca fueron tan importantes
SUSCRIBITE

author: Ivana Rodriguez
title: To us desert teenagers accustomed to triple-digit heat, winter is sudden – and beautiful
text:
It’s a Tuesday morning. The weather is unusually cold, far too cold for kids who have grown up in the desert. As my friends and I walk to class together, huddled closely to share warmth, we begin to talk about what the day will bring until we stop dead in our tracks. As we talk, a fog comes out of our mouths. We breathe out and smile when we come to the realization that it is a special morning.
It is so cold that we can see our own breath.
To others living somewhere where the cold and even snow is a normality, they might just acknowledge it and move on. They might not even notice it.
But to us, desert teenagers so accustomed to over triple-digit degrees, this is a once-in-a-lifetime event. So we stand there, laughing and breathing and swatting away our breath just to start all over again. The bell rings, signaling that we are late to class, but we stay there nonetheless, watching our breath with a special type of wonder as it disappears into the freezing air, and I cannot help but think of how beautiful desert winters can be.
Winter in the desert is sudden. Slowly the mornings get fresher, cooler, until one day it is an absolutely freezing 65 degrees. At school, students wear fur-lined jackets and beanies, long sleeves and thick socks. Administration finally agrees to turn on the heater, and a special kind of warmth and the smell of burning dust flood out of the classrooms' open doors. Through chattering teeth students complain about how much they hate the cold – that the weather is so much better when it’s hot, and how the days are so much more beautiful when the sun is actually providing warmth. However, when chattering teeth have stilled and voices go quiet, the same students who were complaining moments ago are left with resting smiles as they relish the fact that the cold weather has finally arrived.
The Coachella Valley isn’t exactly known for being a winter wonderland. The closest thing we have to blizzards are sandstorms, and it is an unfortunate truth that a snowman wouldn’t stand a chance of survival in our weather. Nonetheless, winter in the desert has always held an especially warm place in my heart. Living in a place iconically known for its year-round heat, this season is something I have always looked forward to.
Winter is the special time when the cicadas finally stop chirping their desert songs and are replaced by the constant hum of Christmas music. Winter marks the beginning of the tourist season as snowbirds pour in and suddenly the barren streets of downtown Palm Springs are brought back to life. Candy Cane Lane lights up once again, and as my sisters and I drive around the decorated cul-de-sac with hot chocolate in our hands and windows down as we blast Wham’s “Last Christmas” – a yearly tradition – I know that the desert winter has finally arrived once again.
Perhaps I am biased from growing up here. I have never seen snowflakes fall from the sky and I have never made a snow angel. I can’t even fathom ice skating on a real frozen lake, let alone sledding down a mountain. However, I can stand by the fact that to me and to many, there is truly nothing like a Coachella Valley winter.
Ivana Rodriguez is a senior at Palm Desert High School. Her email is ivanardriguez9@gmail.com .

author: Ana Ramos Caravaca
title: La borrasca Berenice deja los embalses de Sevilla por encima del 50% de capacidad
text: Agua La borrasca Berenice deja los embalses de Sevilla por encima del 50% de capacidad Guadalcanal ha sido el municipio de Andalucía donde más ha llovido y el segundo de toda España Las últimas lluvias de la [borrasca Berenice](/tags/borrasca/) han ayudado, en gran medida, a llenar los pantanos de la provincia de [Sevilla](/tags/sevilla/). Aunque el paso de la borrasca ha provocado un[ cenenar de incidencias ](/andalucia/2024/10/12/desactivado-andalucia-plan-emergencias-borrasca-berenice-109248706.html)en la provincia, sobre todo [en la Sierra Norte](/andalucia/2024/10/12/inundaciones-ramas-caidas-indecencias-borrasca-berenice-109239952.html), estas precipitaciones han ayudado a que los pantanos de la red de Emasesa incrementen su capacidad en 4 puntos porcentuales, dejando la media en un 51% de capacidad, con 327,14 hm³ de agua embalsada. Hace tan solo una semana, el porcentaje era del 47%, por lo que la borrasca atlántica Berenice ha tenido mucho que ver en este incremento. Son un total de seis los embalses que componen la red de suministro de Emasesa: Aracena, Zufre, Minilla, Gergal, Melonares y Cala. El de mayor capacidad, Melonares, se encuentra, a fecha de 13 de octubre, a un 74,1% de capacidad, con 137,53 hm³ de agua embalsada. Por dimensiones, le sigue el de Zufre, con un 42% de capacidad; Aracena, a un 25,2%; el de Cala, a un 28,7%; la Minilla, al 69,2%, y el de Gergal, que está al 76,1% de su capacidad. No será hasta este martes, 15 de octubre, cuando se haga un balance total del agua recogida en esta última semana, pero está claro que la borrasca ha incrementado el volumen de las presas que abastecen a la provincia. Guadalcanal, el municipio andaluz donde más ha llovido El incremento de los pantanos se debe a las últimas lluvias caídas, sobre todo, en la Sierra Norte. La localidad sevillana de Guadalcanal ha recabado en las últimas 24 horas más de 88 litros por metro cuadrado, convirtiéndose en el municipio de Andalucía, y segundo de España, donde más ha llovido. Le sigue de cerca Almadén de la Plata, donde se han recogido 70,6 litros por metro cuadrado y Cazalla de la Sierra, donde el pluviómetro ha marcado 47,2 litros en la última jornada. También ha recolectado una gran cantidad de agua La Puebla de los infantes y Fuentes de Andalucía, con 40 y 37,6 litros por metro cuadrado, respectivamente. Aunque en Sevilla capital se dejó sentir el paso de la borrasca, los registros pluviométricos cifran en 7 litros por metro cuadrado la cantidad recabada en la ciudad. author: Rod McGuirk
title: US man charged over posts following Australian shooting
text:
An American citizen has been charged in Arizona with making threatening online comments that followed what police describe as a "religiously motivated terrorist attack" in Australia a year ago in which six people died.
Queensland police officers Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold and innocent bystander Alan Dare were fatally shot by Gareth Train, his brother Nathaniel Train and Nathanial's wife, Stacey Train, in an ambush at the Trains' remote property in the rural community of Wieambilla on December 12, 2022.
Four officers had arrived at the property to investigate reports of a missing person. They walked into a hail of gunfire, police said at the time. Two officers managed to escape and raise the alarm.
Police killed the three Trains, who have been described as conspiracy theorists, during a six-hour siege.
The FBI said agents arrested 58-year-old Donald Day Jr near Heber Overgaard, Arizona, last Friday.
Authorities said a federal grand jury indicted Day on two counts of interstate threats. The indictment said that from about the beginning of 2022 until February 2, 2023, Day "engaged in a course of conduct demonstrating a desire to incite violence and threaten a variety of groups and individuals including law enforcement and government authorities".
Day, who lives in the northeastern Arizona town of Heber, was remanded to custody after he appeared in a Phoenix court on Tuesday and faces a potential five-year prison sentence if convicted, according to Arizona prosecutors.
The FBI is still investigating Day's alleged motive.
"The attack involved advanced planning and preparation against law enforcement," Queensland Police Assistant Commissioner Cheryl Scanlon said, referring to the Trains.
"We know that the offenders executed a religiously motivated terrorist attack in Queensland. They were motivated by a Christian extremist ideology."
Australian police allege Gareth Train began following the suspect on YouTube in May 2020. A year later, they were communicating directly.
"The man repeatedly sent messages containing Christian end-of-days ideology to Gareth and then later to Stacey," Scanlon said.
FBI legal attache for Australia Nitiana Mann said the FBI was committed to assisting the Queensland Police Service in its investigation.
"The FBI has a long memory and an even longer reach. From Queensland, Australia, to the remote corners of Arizona," Mann said.
"The FBI and QPS worked jointly and endlessly to bring this man to justice, and he will face the crimes he is alleged to have perpetrated."

author: Bleeding Green Nation
title: Eagles-Commanders Film Preview: This could be a huge A.J. Brown game
text:
I’m not the biggest fan of Eagles game previews, mainly because I don’t have the time to watch even more film during the season. However, this is an easy one, because I’ve watched a ton of Washington Commanders film this year!
I struggle with previews because there’s too much to talk about. I could go on forever. So, I won’t break this down into strengths and weaknesses. I’m just going to give a bunch of thoughts about Washington after watching as much film as possible and looking at the stats. I use a bunch of stats in this one, and credit goes to Team Rankings, PFF, and Sports Info Solutions.

author: JuliaH
title: Full fibre installation
text:
We’re here 24/7. 365 days a year.
Ask questions. Find your answers. Connect.
27 minutes ago
Please help! Day 8 without internet connection since Outreach came to connect full fibre. There was no connection when the engineer left. He said I would have to contact Talktalk as the problem was likely at their end. I have now spent 10 hours being passed from one agent to another including the complaints team who, in spite of promising a call back twice, have failed to get back to me. I am going round in circles and am no further forward. I’ve also tried the 0345 number and have been directed to the chat. I don’t know where to go next. I am normally very calm and patient but my stress levels are now through the roof! What next?
13 minutes ago
Hi Julia,
Can you please update your community profile to include your:
We'll then look into this further. Please do not post this information on this thread. Once you've updated your profile please post in your topic to confirm it's updated.
Thanks
Michelle

author: monserrat.vargas
title: ¡Qué frío! Clima en CDMX llegará a 1 grado el viernes 3 de enero del 2025
text:
El clima en la Ciudad de México (CDMX) para este viernes 3 de enero del 2025 será frío, llegando hasta 1 grado en algunas alcaldías.
La Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil (SGIRPC) informó que activó doble alerta por el pronóstico de temperaturas bajas y posibles heladas en algunas demarcaciones de la capital del país.
Alerta Naranja
La dependencia indicó que se esperan temperaturas de entre 1 y 3 grados Celsius entre las 00:00 y las 08:00 horas de la mañana del viernes 03 de enero de 2025.
Lo anterior en:
- Cuajimalpa
- Milpa Alta
- Tlalpan
Alerta Amarilla
En tanto, se prevén temperaturas de entre 4 y 6 grados Celsius, durante el mismo periodo de tiempo, en:
- Álvaro Obregón
- Coyoacán
- Magdalena Contreras
- Miguel Hidalgo
- Tláhuac
- Xochimilco
Recomendaciones por clima frío en CDMX
Por las bajas temperaturas pronosticadas, la SGIRPC recomendó a la población usar al menos tres capas de ropa, de preferencia de algodón o lana; utilizar crema para proteger e hidratar la piel contra el frío; evitar exponerse a cambios bruscos de temperatura; ingerir abundante agua; consumir frutas y verduras ricas en vitaminas A y C.
Además, lavarse las manos con frecuencia o usar gel antibacterial; en caso de presentar algún malestar, acudir al centro de salud más cercano. Si usas calentadores y/o chimeneas, mantener una ventilación adecuada.
*mvg*

author: FOX 35 Digital Staff
title: Invest 97L: Gov. DeSantis declares state of emergency ahead of tropical system
text: Stream FOX 35 News ORLANDO, Fla. - According to the National Hurricane Center, almost all of Florida could be affected by a tropical system that is expected to develop into a stronger storm within the next week. In response, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency in dozens of counties that could be impacted. According to the hurricane center, this tropical system was expected to impact the eastern Gulf of Mexico and Florida. State officials were advising residents to complete storm preparations now. While this storm may not become a major hurricane, there is growing concern that it may hand over Florida for several days, producing heavy rain and the potential for damaging floods. In a post on X, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis asked residents to follow guidance from the Division of Emergency Management and local officials. Gov. DeSantis declared a state of emergency on Thursday ahead of this tropical system in the following counties: Alachua , Baker, Bay, Bradford, Brevard , Calhoun, Charlotte, Citrus, Clay, Collier, Columbia, DeSoto, Dixie, Duval, Escambia, Flagler , Franklin, Gadsden, Gilchrist , Glades, Gulf, Hamilton, Hardee, Hendry, Hernando, Highlands, Hillsborough, Holmes, Jackson, Jefferson, Lafayette, Lake , Lee, Leon, Levy , Liberty, Madison, Manatee, Marion , Monroe, Nassau, Okaloosa, Okeechobee, Orange , Osceola , Pasco, Pinellas, Polk , Putnam, Santa Rosa, Sarasota, Seminole , St. Johns, Sumter , Suwannee, Taylor, Union, Volusia , Wakulla, Walton, and Washington counties. Meteorologists have urged people along the U.S. Gulf Coast and Atlantic Coast to monitor the system. STAY CONNECTED WITH FOX 35 ORLANDO: for breaking news alerts, latest news headlines for weather alerts & radar Sign up for FOX 35's daily newsletter for the latest morning headlines FOX Local: Stream FOX 35 newscasts, FOX 35 News+, Central Florida Eats on you smart TV "All of Florida should monitor the weather closely as a strengthening tropical system could be in the cards as it passes over historically warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico, with lighter wind shear aloft," said FOX 35 Storm Team Meteorologist Noah Bergren. "A tropical storm at least is now likely. Details regarding potential further strengthening, specific tracks, any stall, and the highest impact area remain unclear. That said, it appears Sunday, Monday, and next Tuesday are the main timeframe for direct tropical impacts to Florida." If the system becomes a named storm, it will be "Debby." Now is a good time to review your hurricane supply checklist. You can find this here . What does a statement of emergency mean? What does it do? Florida has declared a state of emergency in anticipation of a tropical system this weekend, which could cause flooding. This is not a forecast for county impacts from Invest97L (future "Debby") but an ability to free up funding in these areas to reduce red tape for preparation if it’s ultimately needed. "Based on meteorological reports, there is a significant threat of heavy rainfall over most of the State of Florida, with the possibility of at least 12 inches of rainfall over the next seven days," reads the Thursday evening executive order. "The water tables in the affected areas are already nearing peak capacity, and incoming heavy rainfall will cause significant river flooding that may last for several weeks." More resources can be found here and on the FLJHSMV website .

author: Eurosport_FR
title: Moutet contraint de passer son tour à Melbourne
text:
Open d'Australie 2024 : Corentin Moutet annonce son forfait pour le tournoi
Après quatre participations consécutives au tableau final de l'Open d'Australie, Corentin Moutet a annoncé, jeudi soir, son forfait pour l'édition 2024. Le joueur français de 24 ans, actuellement 133e mondial, s'est blessé à l'entraînement mais la nature de sa blessure n'a pas été précisée. "Un jour, ce sera mon jour, je n'ai aucun doute là-dessus", a-t-il notamment souligné.
Actuellement 133e à l'ATP, Corentin Moutet a déclaré forfait pour l'
Open d'Australie 2024. Le joueur français de 24 ans, dont la nature de la blessure n'a pas été précisée, a annoncé la nouvelle jeudi soir dans une story Instagram. "Je me suis blessé sur le terrain aujourd'hui. Je m'entraîne vraiment dur tous les jours. Un jour, ce sera mon jour, je n'ai aucun doute là-dessus. D'ici là, je dois être patient et continuer à travailler dur et faire confiance à mon process. Mon heure viendra", a-t-il écrit.
Corentin Moutet, dont la meilleure performance en Grand Chelem reste un huitième de finale à l'US Open 2022 (perdu face à Casper Ruud), a disputé le tableau final de l'Open d'Australie à cinq reprises depuis 2018. Le natif de Neuilly-sur-Seine n'a jamais été au-delà du deuxième tour à Melbourne (en 2021, 2022 et 2023).
